thread.title: Coronation Street viewers slam the size of Leanne's newborn baby: 'It looks 25'
thread.title_full: Coronation Street viewers slam the size of Leanne's newborn baby: 'It looks 25'

author: Joshua Haigh
title: Coronation Street viewers slam the size of Leanne's newborn baby: 'It looks 25'
text:
Why is the baby so big? Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Coronation Street viewers have been left seriously baffled. 
Leanne gave birth to her baby the past week, and during the latest episode she got to bring her little miracle home for the first time. 
However, the sheer size of her adorable little one made viewers wonder just how long Leanne had been at the hospital for... 
"Could #Corrie really not get a newborn baby? That's the oldest newborn that I've ever seen. So unrealistic," ranted one fan. Fans were left bemused (Photo: ITV) The baby is only a day old (Photo: ITV) 
A second confused fan said: "Leanne's given birth to the only baby old enough to qualify for a State Pension. #Corrie" 
"That baby looks about 25. #corrie," joked another. 
Earlier this week, viewers were distracted by some major flaws in the storyline as Leanne Battersby gave birth to her baby just minutes after going into labour - while trapped in a lift with her sister Toyah. 
Noticeably, there was also no mess following the birth with the baby looking super clean as Leanne held it in her arms - and other viewers demanded to know who cut the umbilical cord from around the baby's neck . Read More Fans slammed the obvious flaw 
One wrote: "One push, no umbilical cord and the baby's about 3 months old. brilliant #corrie." 
Another then posted: "#Corrie that was the quickest birth in the history of soap land, no umbilical cord and the baby looks 3 months old ah shtaaap!!" Like us on Facebook
